Regalister red dress for Android!

By: Irene Cassarino
14-11-2012
Regalister

Time has passed since the first epic release, and Regalister keeps growing and collecting successes.

The IPhone version has got excellent reviews (almost all 5 stars) and now features into the best apps on the ITunes store in its own category (Trends and fashion).

While the ITunes store delivers the version 1.2 (a bunch of much appreciated bug fixes), CEO Davide Bertarini has taken advantage of the incoming holiday (and gift, indeed!) season to release the first Android version, with new exclusive red dress for Christmas!

Now you have no excuses: whether you are an Apple or Google fanatic, download Regalister and enhance your social shopping experience!
With Regalister, you will never ever get wrong gifts


[a giant screenshot from my giant Note2]

Read More

Regalister legendary v1.0 is on the AppStore! Rush!

By: Irene Cassarino
02-08-2012
English, Regalister

We are extremely proud to announce that Regalister, your next IPhone app that will never ever let you get a wrong gift, is now available on the AppStore!

Reviews of the beta version of Regalister are already promising (11 reviews, average 4+), rush and get your personal installation! Early adopters know that every first release is not cool enough w/o a decent supply of little bugs: don’t worry, Regalister won’t crash, but if you want to enjoy the slightly harsh – though unique – feeling of being among the pioneers of a totally new shopping experience, don’t miss the legendary v1.0: updates are coming sooner than you could expect!

Read More Read More

Regalister – Get rid of wrong gifts and get ready for a revolution!

By: Irene Cassarino
21-04-2012
backend, English, Regalister

That’s embarrassing because we cannot entirely reveal yet what Regalister actually does.
Still, believe us. It will bring a breakthrough innovation in the way you experience the very foundation of the limitless wealth of human societies (whether they are modern or pre-industrial): the gift.

Nevertheless, despite such an enormous importance, the gift experience is not properly curated and sometime ends with frustration, misunderstandings and even tragedies!

Every gift has a meaning in the mind of the one that gives it: if only for time expensive evaluations, consultations, wanderings that sometimes it involves. Not to speak about the subtle shame that one invariably feels when she’s aware that her gift is banal, insipid.
The tragedy comes when, despite all that pathos, the receiver responds with indifference, a smile of convenience or a trace of annoyance.

You may say: that’s the cost that you have to pay if you want to make a surprise! Forget it: the real surprise is getting something you always wanted from an unexpected person, or even the very person you wanted to show her love in that way.

So: here comes Regalister.

We have already said and shown too much!
Want to know more? Visit Regalister’s landing page and subscribe to the mailing list.
Want to have fun? Share your worst crappy gifts and vote other’s: it’s the best way to get rid of them

Read More Read More Read More

About

Either it's bad luck, or bright destiny.

We are doers. Internet enthusiasts, passionate about design&coding, humble learners and bold explorers.
We love start-ups.
